responses.text: Hello, anyone there?

messages.text: Oh hi!
I guess this means you're using my app then…

responses.title: Yeah, I suppose it does
responses.text: Yeah, I suppose it does

messages.text: Cool 😄
So, my name is Pat. I made this app to tell you a little about myself, and show you some things I've built.
What would you like to know about first?

messages.help_text: By the way, if you need help or to restart, use the settings cog at the top left ↖ ⚙

This is me on Christmas day last year down at the beach.
Want another?

responses.title: Yeah for sure!
responses.text: Yeah for sure! Let's have another!

responses.text: No thanks. Anyway, where do you go to school? 🎓

messages.text: I'm trying to get my motorcycle license, this is me and my dad the other day going for a slow ride around.

responses.title: Nice photo!
responses.text:
Nice photo!
So, where do you go to school? 🎓

responses.title: Vroom Vroom! 🏍🏍
responses.text:
Vroom Vroom! 🏍🏍
Uh anyway, where do you go to school? 🎓

messages.text: I'm a full-time student at the University of Technology, Sydney studying a combined Bachelor of Business, Bachelor of Computing.

messages.help_text: Press with different levels of force to fly around the map! (Keep your finger on the screen and adjust your force, you'll get the hang of it I'm sure 🙂)

messages.text: I'm majoring in Marketing (for the Business) and Programming (for the Computing).
You probably could've guessed the programming part 😜
I've recently turned 21 and have completed two and half years of my four year degree. (Random fact: I share a birthday with Apple!)

responses.title: Plans for the rest of the degree?
responses.text: What's your plan for the last year and a half of your degree?

responses.title: Where are you from?
responses.text: I see you go to UTS, are you originally from Sydney?

messages.text: Pending final approval (fingers crossed), I will be spending next semester studying abroad.
I have applied to George Mason University, in Fairfax Virginia, to study one semester of IT and computer science.
After that I have one year left of my degree at UTS

responses.title: Any out of school learning?
responses.text: Have you done any out of school learning?

responses.title: Where are you from?
responses.text: I see you go to UTS, are you originally from Sydney?

messages.text: At the end of 2014 I was selected to attend the PricewaterhouseCoopers Technology Academy Program.
Last year I attended WWDC on a scholarship where I learnt an immeasurable amount in a week.
I also attend the monthly CocoaHeads Sydney meetups where I learn from the best in Sydney in our field.
I've also made a tonne of friends through CocoaHeads.

responses.title: Where are you from?
responses.text: I see you go to UTS, are you originally from Sydney?

messages.text: Yeah.
I'm born and raised in the Eastern Suburbs of Sydney, Australia.
Somewhat close to this:
Ok, bit of a lie. I'm actually closer to this:

responses.title: What's your background in computing?
responses.text: So you like programming I take it. What's your background in computing? 🖥

messages.text: I started working with HTML creating small websites when I was 12 and from there began to discover other ways of interacting with computers.
My father taught me Microsoft DOS and all the ways small scripts could make life easier.

In 2009 I saved up all my birthday money to buy myself an iPod Touch. Using my love of tinkering and creating, I created my first iPhone OS Web App. It was a simple Magic 8 ball and sparked my fascination with software development.
From there I began developing iOS applications and learning to program. I'll tell you more about my projects and hobbies if you'd like?

responses.title: Your Hobbies
responses.text: Ok, do you have any hobbies? 🏉⛷

responses.title: Your Projects
responses.text: Yeah, your projects, thanks. Are you working on anything cool? ⚗🔭📲

responses.title: This App
responses.text: I would like to know a bit more about this app, thanks. It's an interesting way of structuring this! 📱

messages.text: Yeah a few too many actually hahaha
I love to ski, play piano and take photos.
I have been skiing for most of life and I can’t describe just how free I feel when skiing.
In high school I competed in the Sydney Regional and NSW state interschool ski racing competitions. I was also Captain of my school’s ski team in 2012.
I have played the piano since 2002, and while I consider myself pretty good I do mostly play for enjoyment.
I have built a small proof of concept iPad app to store my sheet music and chords.
I would like to polish it off someday and release it to the App Store.
I have a keen interest in photography. I studied film photography in High School and continue using my knowledge today when taking travel photos.
In 2015 alone I took 4,872 photos (over fourteen hundred of which were with my iPhone)
↑ This is my second favourite photo that I've taken this year so far.

responses.title: Can I see your favourite?
responses.text: So what is your favourite?

responses.title: Any other hobbies?
responses.text: Do you have any other hobbies?

messages.text: I took this one out of a car in the outback in Western Australia on the day before Australia Day this year. It's one of those photos you just can't help but smile at 😊
Like it?

responses.title: Love it!
responses.text: Love it! Anyway, do you have any other hobbies?

responses.title: Any other hobbies?
responses.text: Do you have any other hobbies?

messages.text: LIGHTNING ROUND!
In high school I was heavily involved in the production crew, specialising in theatrical lighting. 🎭
I love travelling. I think the only way to know yourself is to explore the world. I have a map of the world on my wall that I hope to one day have completely coloured in!
And finally, drum roll please…
Programming! It may be what I study, and my day-to-day job at my internship, but it's also one of my favourite hobbies!
Messing around and building stuff from small ideas is one of the most rewarding things I do 😊💻
What next?

responses.title: More about your programming projects
responses.text: Can you please tell me more about your programming projects. Are you working on anything cool? 💻🔭📲

responses.title: You Personally
responses.text: A bit more about you personally. Can I see a photo, please?

responses.title: This App
responses.text: Tell me a bit more about app, please. It's an interesting way of structuring this! 📱

messages.text: In December 2015 I started an internship at The Star Entertainment Group in Sydney. They own and operate some casinos in Australia.
For them I have worked on rebuilding the Kiosk project.
I worked on a collection of enterpirse apps for a small student run startup during the later half of last year.
I have also continued to progress my most successful, and first (2010), app 'Gibbs Rules (from NCIS)', which has over 250,000 downloads and over 5,000 monthly active users.
I have also been teaching myself about internet connect devices and have built a little Arduino project to log the climate in my bedroom.
And I've got a bunch of other cool stuff in the pipeline too!

responses.title: Tell me about your internship
responses.text: Tell me some more about your internship please.

responses.title: Tell me about that successful app
responses.text: 2010? You were what, 15!? Tell me some more about Gibbs Rules.

responses.title: Tell me about this future pipeline
responses.text: Tell me some more about this future pipeline please.

messages.text: As part of my internship I'm in a two person iOS team where we're rebuilding a Kiosk app.
On the surface it's a simple enough idea -- an iPad that consumes a REST API to look up customer data.

But the interesting part is in the external accessories: 
· A magnetic card reader
· A thermal receipt printer

responses.title: Can I see some screenshots?
responses.text: Can I see some screenshots?

messages.text: OK, I got special permission to show these to your eyes only. The data is mock (obviously).
This is the Dashboard that is shown when the user swipes in.
And this is the validation engine I built for the password reset screen.
Cool right?

messages.text: My first iOS app is Gibbs’ Rules (for NCIS), a companion to the television drama NCIS.
Along with being my first released app, it is also my most successful, currently over 250,000 downloads since December 2010.
Want to know more about Gibbs Rules? (Like the awesome iOS technologies included!)

responses.title: Yeah sure
responses.text: Yes please :D

responses.title: No thanks
responses.text: No thanks

messages.text: Cool!
Late last year I decided to release a major overhaul of the app
It took me a few months to finish, but the new version included awesome new technologies like a full support for Spotlight Search for all the rules and the user's favourite rules
Also, Background refresh (that required I set up a server for the content), and 3D Touch with Peek and Pop
I also decided to add a Tip Jar In App Purchase model to the app, and so far that has been very successful

responses.title: Do people like it?
responses.text: Do people like it?

responses.title: That's great!
responses.text: That's great!

messages.text: Yeah people LOVE it!
The most rewarding part of it all is the emails and user feedback I get
And of course the ratings!
The app as a whole has a 4.5 star rating and the current version has a ★★★★★ rating!!
Building apps is awesome, building apps others love is out of this world!

messages.text_prefix: The temperature in my room is:

messages.text: That's current as of less than fifteen minutes ago.
Using this link you can see the log:
Using a starter kit, and a few extra components, my dad and I built a little Arduino that logs the temperature and humidity every 15 minutes to my server.

messages.help_text: That's a live photo, by the way, try 3D Touch it!

messages.text: I'm currently building an app for sharing the movies you like with your friends.
Think 'Swarm for movies'. Check it out at Specular.club
I've also been playing around with the Transport for NSW live data for buses and trains trying to come up with a small app I could make there.
I'm also deeply fascinated by data, so I tried my best at a comprehensive statistical analysis of my year 2015, you can see here:

responses.title: This App
responses.text: A bit more about this app, thanks. It's an interesting way of structuring this! 📱

messages.text: This app is based on the dialogue engine in the Firewatch game and the 2016 Quartz app for iPhone.
It's taken me over 25 hours in Xcode (according to my time tracker), and surely longer in design.
The 3D touch interactive maps were the most difficult to balance discoverability with user experience in load times, and the large memory footprint of the 3D maps.
A considerable amount of time was also spent on the UITableView insert animations to ensure the messages scrolled up smoothly. I'm quite happy with it 😃
You can read more about the features and obstacles in my essay. What would you like to know next?
